page.title: 04SOCIAL SURVEY
page.content: THE SURVEY COVERED THE WHOLE OF THE AREA FROM THE HOUSING DEVELOPMENTS IN DOWNGATE TO THE MOST ISOLATED FARM DWELLING. IT WAS FOUND THAT THE {INDIGINOUS POPULATION IS OUTNUMBERED {TWO TO ONE ,}WITH A{THIRD OF THE {PEOPLE}SURVEYED HAVING{LIVED IN THE {AREA}FOR{LESS THAN FIVE YEARS.}THE MAJORITY OF THE{LIFE LONG RESIDENTS {WORK OR WORKED ON THE LAND}BEFORE THEIR RETIREMENT. THE{NEWCOMERS}TEND TO WORK IN THE NEARBY{URBAN AREAS COMMUTING TO{PLYMOUTH}FOR{OFFICE WORK, THE{NAVEL DOCKYARDS AT DEVONPORT}OR THE{ROYAL NAVY ESTABLISHMENTS.}SEVEN OUT OF TEN PEOPLE SURVEYED USED CAR TO GET TO WORK WITH EIGHTOUT OF TEN HOUSEHOLDS HAVING ONE OR MORE CARS AT THEIR DISPOSAL. THE MAIN REASON GIVEN FOR{PEOPLE COMING}TO{CORNWALL}WAS {NOT EMPLOYMENT}HOWEVER, SIMPLY THAT THEY{LIKED THE AREA.
